casebody.data:
A.L.C., Appellant,
v.
W.J.C., Respondent. No. ED 105303 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION THREE. Filed: February 6, 2018 FOR APPELLANT: Nathaniel G. Diekman, James J. Leightner, 230 S. Bemiston, Suite 600, Clayton, MO 63105. FOR RESPONDENT: William J. Cooseman, Respondent Acting Pro Se, 6909 Wellsford Court Dr., St. Louis, MO 63129, Jennifer Graves Borcherding, Guardian Ad Litem, 8131 Manchester Rd., Brentwood, MO 63144. Before Gary M. Gaertner, Jr., P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

A.L.C. appeals various portions of the trial court's judgment in favor of W.J.C. relating to his motion to modify. We find no error has occurred.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The judgment of the trial court is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b).
